positionName: Lead Electrical Engineer - Laboratory Facilities Projects
description:

Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
  You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.

  When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
 
 

 Job Description
  AECOM Buildings + Places is building a pipeline of qualified Senior Electrical Engineer candidates to potentially hire from to work on federal government laboratory facilities projects in the Ottawa and/or Montreal area.
  Major Responsibilities:
  The Senior Electrical engineer will be expected to:
  Be able to conduct on-site review at any existing Lab facilities, to prepare an electrical risk and hazard assessment of existing operations.
  Analyse the electrical requirements and available capacity from existing substation or available electric service providers of projects.
  Provide an analysis of how to carry electrical service to site and any necessary and/or recommended upgrades needed.
  Analyse the requirements for new emergency and UPS power.
  Analyse the requirements for the new telecom cabling: fibre and copper.
  Confirm of the electrical supply authority’s requirements and supply line capacity, including configuration of the supply network (e.g., lines, switch gear, vault access, etc.) and confirm of supply authority’s fees, disbursements, and timelines for network engineering and construction/reconfiguration.
  Confirm required lighting levels based on the Project’s program requirements, validating that building, Site, and security-related lighting requirements meet the Canada Occupational Health and Safety Regulations, as referenced in the RLDF (Chapter 4) and Illuminating Engineering Society of North America.
  Identify scope, assumptions, analysis process(es), and whole-building energy analysis, and energy Models meeting the ASHRAE 140 Standard, using software approved by the DR, to evaluate SD and DD options and determine best-value measures for optimal energy performance.
  Review requirements for, inter-disciplinary input to, calculation frequency of, systems and overall Project LCA and LCCA, in accordance with provided Sustainability Analysis.
  Indicate proposed normal, emergency and UPS electrical distribution requirements and provide a narrative description of the new electrical requirements including, in coordination with the architectural lighting, sustainability, and mechanical disciplines:
  Include future loads for building including the Site and Site lighting and provision for electrical car charging stations in parking areas.
  Indicate of the opportunities related to innovation and requirements to achieve integrated building, sub-system, and localized energy metering systems and integration of new intelligent building technologies.
  Provide a narrative description and sketches of findings and incorporate into the Model. Include physical constraints on proposed distribution (i.e., Site infrastructure, building layouts, conduits, and chases).
 
  Model and provide narrative explanation of the approach and guidelines for temporary power systems for construction operations, including within enclosed scaffolding. Confirm power supply limitations, tie-in locations, and capacities.
  Identify lighting, security and Site lighting and related control requirements, and provide narrative of the new requirements: proposed lighting control system(s), their spatial requirements, and incorporate proposed control systems into the Model. Describe building and security and Site lighting control requirements and functionality, location of central control station(s), and integration with the control and metering of other power systems.
  Demonstrated record of successful cost management on large construction projects
 
 
 

 Qualifications
  Minimum Requirements:
  In order to be considered, applicants must possess no less than the following:
  University Degree in Electrical Engineering + eight (8) years of experience in the electrical design of science & technology buildings (ie. laboratories, research areas and facilities.)
  Demonstrated equivalency of experience and/or education may be considered.
  Professional Engineering license.
  Preferred Requirements:
  Prefer fifteen (15)+ years of experience experience in the electrical design of science & technology buildings (ie. laboratories, research areas and facilities)
  Additional Information
  
 
   Relocation is not available for this position.
   Sponsorship for Canadian employment authorization is not available for this position.
   Offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, qualifications, experience, and work location. The salary range for this position is $176,000 - $218,000.
